intro: Cirsium cymosum, commonly known as the clustered thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a stout, hairy stem and spiny, lobed foliage. Its flowers are usually purple to pink, arranged in dense, spherical clusters at the top of the plant. Cirsium cymosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
